headline.main: First Armed Ships to Go in a Week, All at Sea by Spring, Says Knox; Guns and Their Crews Ready, He Says -- Craft Registered in Panama May Be Retaken -- Premature Convoys Denied

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Nov. 19 -- The first armed American merchant ships will go to sea in a week or ten days and others will follow in rapid succession, as soon as they can go into ports and be fitted with weapons, Secretary Knox stated today.
abstract: Knox on new icebreakers ordered for Coast Guard
snippet: WASHINGTON, Nov. 19 -- The first armed American merchant ships will go to sea in a week or ten days and others will follow in rapid succession, as soon as they can go into ports and be fitted with weapons, Secretary Knox stated today....

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES
